attributes.action: Make Commonwealth Day a public holiday in the UK.
attributes.background: Commonwealth Day is the second Monday in March. When the UK leaves the EU it will need to be global facing to make Brexit a success. Celebrating Commonwealth Day with a public holiday will help remind the UK public of its friends around the world who share history and cultural values with the UK.

attributes.action: Stop the demolition of the rest facilities on A35 Dorchester
attributes.background:
These are used by approx 2000 people a week. 
Demolishing these toilets is not the answer, they are a necessity. 
Build another rest area or sort the vandalism problem out but you can not just demolish something that is so obviously needed.
What happened to drivers being encouraged to rest.
attributes.additional_details:
Even Highways England have not denied how busy these facilities are, their reason for demolition is vandalism. 
Demolishing these toilets is not the answer. Shame on you Highways England.

attributes.action: Ban the use of meat and dairy produce at all government functions and meals
attributes.background: Meat and dairy is the greatest contributor to greenhouse gases. It is also a driver of rainforest destruction. It condemns billions of sentient animals to confined lives and a violent death. It is urgent that the UK government takes a lead in adopting Vegan diets for official functions and meals

attributes.action: Make Bullying in the workplace a criminal offence.
attributes.background: Bullying is wrong. Bullying goes on in the workplace.  It can be being left out , whatever it may be.  It can be being ignored.  It can be not getting that promotion.  Social media passive aggressive post. Commenting on work performance negatively, and talking in derogatory terms.
attributes.additional_details: Workplace Bullying is rife. A real problem, that can have severe consequences to a person being bullied. Just because a manager may smile at you, does not mean that they aren't bullying someone else.

attributes.action: Devote some of the UK's aid budget to supporting Ugandan LGBT refugees in Kenya.
attributes.background: Homophobic laws in Uganda cause many LGBT people to seek refuge in Kenya where they apply for refugee status. Even in Kenya they are persecuted and subject to police brutality and often become destitute while their asylum claims are processed. They despirately need safe accommodation and food.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LGBT_rights_in_Nigeria

http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/meet-lgbti-ugandan-community-living-fear-kenyas-kakuma-refugee-camp-1566516

http://www.huffingtonpost.com/the-groundtruth-project/inside-the-nightmares-of_b_7674502.html

attributes.action: Apply VAT on airfares to better fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is underfunded; at the end of 2015/16 the NHS had a deficit of £1.85 billion. Aviation is lightly taxed but harmful, eg it impairs children's learning ability and is detrimental to wildlife. It is also exacerbating our climate crisis and in 2014 produced over 11% of the UK’s total emissions.
attributes.additional_details:
Airline passengers do not pay fuel duty or VAT and APD can be as low as £13. We might think this makes annual holidays affordable but in fact undertaxed flights largely benefit affluent people who fly several times a year; 70% of flights are taken by only 15% of adults.

My petition is to apply VAT on airfares and for the additional revenue to be used to support our NHS. Most of us like an annual holiday but those of us who can afford 2 to 3 holidays each year can also afford to pay more tax.

attributes.action: A motion to call a vote on MPs confidence in the government's future NHS plans.
attributes.background: NHS is under increasing strain. Staff are overworked, NHS vacancies are left unfilled (highlighting a need for increased training through government subsides) and doctors have been accused of not doing enough. This cannot continue. We need a change of plan which should be put to a parliament vote.
attributes.additional_details:
ITV report https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jAg2aHgVBSA 
Sky News Report http://www.classicfm.com/radio/news/uk-world/nhs-crisis-theresa-may-frustrated-over-gp-ope/
Debate with lots of evidence http://parliamentlive.tv/event/index/b18b254b-2450-4a4d-86d0-947792490a6c?in=16:30:00
Leak showing extent of 2017 winter crisis http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-38570960

attributes.action: Mandatory for all employers to offer a phased return to work for new parents
attributes.background: Offering working parents a phased return to work will help to provide a smoother transition back to work. Providing the stay at home parent with an enhanced support system and allowing the working parent more time to form a positive relationship without as much of a financial burden.

attributes.action: To have all school zones become 20mph for the safety of children.
attributes.background: We expect all of our children to go to school safely often schools are on busy main roads or down country lanes.  Visibility of the children can be poor and parents having to go on to work, parking can also cause a temporary hazard.  We fairly request roads have their speed limits lowered to 20mph.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Safety Analysis (RSA) body found that there were 85,814 road incidents within a 500 mtr radius of a school equating to more than a 1,000 per month.  In 2014 the Department of Transport confirmed road deaths or serious had risen in each quarter compared to 2013.  In this period the DfT confirmed incidents increased by 6%.

These are frightening figures and it wouldn't take much to put up a few signs telling motorists to reduce their speed to 20mph at national government cost.

attributes.action: Include School Transport to salary sacrifice schemes to enable tax/NI savings
attributes.background: Many working parents are facing high costs for self funding school transport. For some families this can be £1000s each year. We would like school transport vouchers to be included in the government salary sacrifice schemes in the same way that childcare vouchers and cycle to work schemes are.
attributes.additional_details: The government currently funds school transport for children attending their nearest school, for many families the nearest school is not the best option so they choose to self-fund transport and send their child to another school. For parents making this decision they are generating £1000s in cost savings to local councils as the council no longer has the financial obligation to provide transport. We ask the government to support working families with this simple change.

attributes.action: Make equal rights the heart of any trade deal with America.
attributes.background: Soon we will begin discussions with America on a trade deal; we should ensure that equal worker rights based on gender, sexuality, religion and race will be enshrined in this deal.
attributes.additional_details: Britain has always had a special relationship with America. This relationship has been forged as two nations who have fought side by side to defend the rights of the individual. Brexit has given us an opportunity to create our own trade deals with nations. We should use these trade deals to cement the shared values we hold dear.

attributes.action: Form cross party committee to agree strategy & funding of the NHS & care support
attributes.background: We need to agree a long term strategy for the NHS, to ensure we maximise our incredible resources and expertise. We have difficult choices to make: modernising to ensure we offer a consistent 7 day service; identify a way to fund the increasing demand; and how we fund elderly care in the community.
attributes.additional_details:
We have an increasingly ageing population with improved medical advances. The service needs to remove the administrative burdens and focus on efficient world class care, which will require moving to a manufacturing shift pattern impacting ALL staff, requiring cross party support. 
To maximise the use of hospital beds we need to review the control & funding of aftercare/nursing homes to ensure quality and remove the bottlenecks between the NHS and local authorities, changes to tax structure?

attributes.action: Compel energy providers to offer the cheapest tariffs on pre-pay meters.
attributes.background: Users of pre-pay meters are unfairly disadvantaged when purchasing energy to heat their homes. Although often on lower incomes they actually have to pay a higher rate. This is "fuel poverty" - higher tariffs result in people going without food or other essentials as they just try to keep warm.
attributes.additional_details: Guardian article https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/jan/19/fuel-poverty-heating-disabled-cold-penalised-energy-tariff

attributes.action: Include women in the national screening programme for abdominal aortic aneurysms
attributes.background: Public Health England run a national screening programme for men aged ≥65 to detect abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA). If left undetected, a AAA rupture is fatal in 90% of cases. The condition is not unique to men, women also suffer and die from AAA ruptures. So why aren't women also screened?
attributes.additional_details:
Screening is a way of detecting an aneurysm early. If the abdominal aortic artery gets particularly swollen, you might feel a pulsating feeling or pain in your stomach or back pain. If you don't experience this, you won’t know you have an aneurysm until it bursts, when it becomes an emergency and is usually fatal.
Ruptured AAAs are less common in women and, on average, occur 10 years later than in men.So why is there not a screening programme for women aged 75 or above? Women are equal!

attributes.action: Deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary.
attributes.background: Following the demise of the NHS through lack of funding please deliberate a vote of No Confidence in Jeremy Hunt the Health Secretary to change the direction of the NHS and protect it for future generation's. Our lives depend on it!

attributes.action: Add Euro Indexation to the State Pension triple-lock
attributes.background: Since the Brexit vote on 23 June, the value of the pound has been falling. Those on private pensions have seen a surge in value as international companies and world markets prosper. Average earnings and the consumer price index will remain muted, leading to a fall in the value of the State Pension.
attributes.additional_details: On 23 June, the pound was worth 1.30169 Euro (ref. OANDA) - by the end of the year it had lost more than 10% of its value. This trend is likely to continue. By November, the CPI was only 1.2% (ref. ONS). - The Pensions Committee is thinking of scrapping the triple-lock, but we suggest replacing "or 2.5%" with "or 1.30169/FX" where FX is the value of the Pound in terms of the Euro.

attributes.action: Stop bombing syria and provide support.
attributes.background: In syria a child's life is worth a bullet in the chamber of a soldier, the lives of all the mothers and children that die are only seen as colletral damage to the superpowers of the world, thats why i believe support from the united kingdom would be of much help to re-developing a nation.

attributes.action: Any EU national came after BREXIT referendum Should not get right to Stay in UK
attributes.background:
UK is already overcrowded,
NHS is streched, 
British Family is struggling to get choice of education as schools are already over crowded, 
EU haven't provided guarantee for UK national so why should uk give guarantee for EU national
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Statistics Authority has said the EU membership fee figure of £19 billion a year, or £350 million a week,
The UK pays more than £670m to EU countries for Britons' healthcare abroad, while claiming back less than £50m from the EU,even though there are significantly more EU citizens in the UK than UK citizens in the EU.
For example the UK pays France £147,685,772, but France only pays UK £6,730,292 and the UK pays Germany £25,873,954 but Germany only pays the UK £2,189,664

attributes.action: “To require the Government to repeal Section 40 of the Crime and Courts Act 2013
attributes.background: The majority of British Newspapers want nothing to do with 'Impress' as an 'independent regulator'; because the Freedom of the Press is a rare and treasured commodity.
attributes.additional_details: I refer to the excellent article written by Mr. Fraser Nelson in the Telegraph

attributes.action: Set up of a Men's Equality committee to address issues like male rape & suicide.
attributes.background:
There is already a Women & Equalities Committee, but it has not yet done any inquiries into issues facing men, such as; 
1* Suicide (three times as high in men) 
2* Male rape (where services for men are insufficient) 
3* Domestic violence against men (misreported as only affecting women).
attributes.additional_details:
1. suicide rates by gender 16.8 per 100,000 for men and 5.2 per 100,000 for women from Samaritans website http://www.samaritans.org/about-us/our-research/facts-and-figures-about-suicide 
2. 85,000 women and 12,000 men raped per year. http://rapecrisis.org.uk/statistics.php
3. 1 in 4 women and 1 in 6 men - http://www.lwa.org.uk/understanding-abuse/statistics.htm”

attributes.action: Education funding should be ring fenced pupils funded equally.
attributes.background: Changes announced today (14 December) in the way schools will be funded in the future is just robbing Peter to pay Paul. Children are our future and they should be educated equally whenever they live.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are oversubscribed in some areas and others undersubscribed however equal funding would  hopefully address this problem and enable heads to allocate funding according to the needs of their pupils.

attributes.action: A  Vote of No Confidence in the Transport Secretary re Southern Railways dispute
attributes.background: The Transport Secretary has made it clear  he has no interest in the Southern/RMT/ASLEF rail dispute. People have lost their jobs, been refused job interviews & in some cases missed hospital appointments. His lack of action is grossly negligent and he should no longer be a government minister.

attributes.action: A life sentence to mean life imprisonment.
attributes.background: A life sentence handed out to criminals should mean they spend the rest of their life behind bars with no option for early release
attributes.additional_details: All too often we hear of people being sentenced for horrific crimes and murders and are told they've been given a 'life sentence ' of which they must serve a minimum of 4 years or something ridiculous like that. Life should mean life, to combat the response of "we don't have the money or the space" - in these cases bring back the death penalty for murderers and child abusers who show no remorse and stop imprisoning people for petty offences like 'possession of cannabis'

attributes.action: Reinstate legal aid for students and people on a low income
attributes.background: Many people need the help of solicitors and courts all around the UK for various reasons but can't afford the costs by themselves. The 1st of April 2013 saw legal aid was discontinued. This petition will see that people are able to receive help in many cases that legal aid covered.
attributes.additional_details:
When legal aid was discontinued this meant some types of case were no longer eligible for public funds - including divorce, child contact, welfare benefits, employment, clinical negligence, and housing law except in very limited circumstances. (BBC news) 
This petition should be looked into by Houses of Parliament and even if only a few were reinstated for legal aid such as child contact being the main issue as every parent and child should be together and some parents can't afford legal costs.

attributes.action: To make November 11th a bank holiday
attributes.background: To remember all the fallen heros

attributes.action: Require all universities by law to consider applications anonymously.
attributes.background: Recent studies have shown that perfectly able candidates are not being offered the same opportunities due to 'name discrimination'. This can be in the form of prejudice surrounding names related to ethnic origin or even gender discrimination within big companies that would like more male employees.
attributes.additional_details:
-Dr. Colin Holbrook, a research scientist at the UCLA Center for Behavior, Evolution, and Culture has recently done a study showing that names have an influence on job interviews and university places in terms of race and gender.
-By making it law for organisations such as UCAS to require anonymous applications it will hopefully prevent discrimination against those with ethnic-sounding or just clear gender identifiable names, based on stereotypes.

attributes.action: Consider a second runway for Gatwick
attributes.background: Why allocate a 3rd runway to Heathrow when Gatwick will fund 2nd runway

attributes.action: Lola's Law- people must stop and report a cat has been run over
attributes.background: Leaving them is simply saying cats aren't important. I suffer with PTSD Witnessing a traumatic event like this can be extremely overwhelming. I was surprised the law meant the driver didn't have to stop. Our cat was chipped,they could have taken her to a vet rather than leave for our family to see
attributes.additional_details: My Lola was run over,left with her organs out of her body. If we can't put speed limits in these roads,why can't we have a law just like the Road Traffic Act 1988 for dogs. Cat's are just as domesticated as dogs, don't families deserve closure? It's so traumatic for an owner. The least someone could do is report what happened.Please help by signing this petition, it could really make a difference.It has to reach 100,000 signatures to even be considered by the government,every name counts.

attributes.action: England to become completely Independant from Scotland,Wales & Northern Ireland
attributes.background: We the English People wish to become completely independant from the othe UK members

attributes.action: Hi my name is Caitlin gray and I would like to make  bullying against the law
attributes.background: People that get bullied can't handle it and want to end their life with no question about it and I want to change that I want to make it stop because we shouldn't have to deal with it so I would like to make bullying against the law.

It needs to stop and I'm crying out for something to stop it and I feel strongly for this to be heard and stopped. attributes.action: Make teaching a nuanced account of the British Empire statutory in KS3 History
attributes.background: In their next revision of the national curriculum, the UK government should update Key Stage 3 history so that teaching about the British Empire is statutory. A nuanced account about the oppressive nature of the empire is needed to education those who are unaware of Britain's problematic empire

attributes.action: Make family courts use beyond reasonable doubt instead of probabilities.
attributes.background: Family courts in the U.K. Use a system where they can take our children away from parents and families on the balance of probabilities, this petition is to change that to Beyond Reasonable Doubt to protect our human rights and keep loving families together.
attributes.additional_details: This happens all over the U.K

attributes.action: Include companies' wrongdoings to employees in the list of protected disclosures
attributes.background: Allow all information about retail companies' wrongdoings to their employees to be published and protected by law. We want to know the names of companies that such allegations are about and see all information in relation to the allegations even if it is confidential or intellectual property.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that the government change the law on raising awareness about companies' wrongdoings called 'whistleblowing' (disclosure in the public interest).

Retail companies that are doing wrong to their employees cannot be trusted. The public are customers of retail companies. Therefore, if such companies are doing wrong to an employee then the disclosure of the wrongdoing should always be protected by law as it is in the public interest to know about the wrongdoing.

attributes.action: Allow people who are born blind in one eye, to register as partially sighted.
attributes.background: If you are born with eyesight in one eye you, cant register as partially sighted unless you have problems with your other eye.

attributes.action: Create abandoned buildings suitable for the homeless
attributes.background: To many people are living on the streets, we have so many abandoned buildings that arnt being used at all we need to open these buildings for the homeless, free of charge or affordable for them.

attributes.action: Reduce income tax for people who are earning under £43,000 from 20% to 15%.
attributes.background: People all over the United Kingdom work very hard for their money that they earn, and are being taxed way too much. If 5% was reduced from the general tax rate, employees would be much happier with their jobs. Unemployed people will be more likely to work as the salary rates will be more appealing.

attributes.action: Abolish Vehicle Excise Duty (VED) and put extra tax on fuel
attributes.background:
The air in British cities is polluted by exhaust fumes and is killing thousands of people.

 Abolish VED and replace it with extra fuel tax of 3 p per litre on petrol and 10 p per litre on diesel so that the tax paid is in line with mileage and using the most polluting vehicles is discouraged.
attributes.additional_details:
See this link
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-34257424
and many more press reports

attributes.action: Let the speaker speak! A motion of the House in support of the Speaker.
attributes.background: On the 06th February the Speaker of the House of Commons spoke up to voice the views of many that President Trump not be allowed to address the House. Now he faces a no confidence motion.This petition seeks support for the debate of a counter motion of support for his position.Don't gag the Speaker!
attributes.additional_details: James Duddridge MP has sought to attack the Speaker. Over 1 million people signed a petition objecting to Trump's State visit and furthermore there is disquiet across the House regarding it. The Speaker must maintain order and preserve the dignity of the House. He was accordingly obliged to intervene when the Prime Minister elected to offer a State visit to such a divisive figure who sows discord and disorder.Let the Speaker Speak.

attributes.action: Stop speed restricted vehicles from overtaking during peak hours on motorways
attributes.background:
HGVs frequently 'elephant race' trying to pass each other. This overtaking frequently takes up to 10 miles due to the subtle differences in speed limiter calibration. 

This causes long tailbacks, dangerous pulsating traffic flow and frustration to other motorists leading to dangerous manoeuvres.
attributes.additional_details:
No other form of transport, motorised, cycling or pedestrian would you consider an overtake that took this time
Transitioning from a 2 lane motorway to a 3 lane section can lead to HGVs 3 abreast creating a rolling road block for several miles
HGVs have blind spots, pulling into spaces that either don’t exist or into traffic flow travelling much faster
Cranes, vintage vehicles and buses only capable of travelling at agricultural speeds to have time restrictions motorway travel times

attributes.action: Clerks of the House of Commons to continue wearing wigs and court dress
attributes.background: We believe that changes to the attire of the clerks after the February recess fail to take account of the traditions of the House of Commons.  The so called 'executive order' needs to be debated be repealed.  It ain't broke, so don't fix it

attributes.action: Make toll roads free for HGV's
attributes.background: With rising costs associated with running haulage companies including fuel, road tax, operator licence fees e.t.c toll roads are a cost that should be wavered for HGV. A prime example being the M6 toll. Allowing HGV'S to use this for free would have a massively positive impact on congestion.

attributes.action: Introduce Regular Digital Voting Referendums On The Issues That Matter
attributes.background: The technology for 'push-button digital voting' by mobile phone or pc already exists. People vote on tv show contestants all the time. Mobile and online banking are deemed to be secure. Thus there's no reason why this technology cannot be adapted for digital referendums to truly empower the people.
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister Theresa May has spoken of the 'shared society.' It would be nice to see some power being shared with our representatives at the UK Parliament and the devolved Parliaments and Assemblies. 

Regular digital voting on issues that matter at a local and national level, would leave everyone clear on what the majority wish for on any number of issues. A more intelligent vote could also arise; Eg: someone with good knowledge of farming would vote on it, though perhaps not vote on fishing.

attributes.action: Heavier prison scentences for pedophiles and rapists.
attributes.background: I firmly believe that the scentences handed out to pedophiles and rapists are far to lenient.When someone commits a crime against a child or rapes a person they are as good as murdering who that person once was
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has been raped or abused will tell you they will never be the same again...in essence the person they once were is now dead...children who are abused have their childhood stolen from them..the perpetrators of such unspeakble acts deserve to be punished severly and the victims at the very least deserve the justice that harsher scentences would bring

attributes.action: Give the British public a referendum on cutting foreign aid. Give it to the NHS
attributes.background:
An overwhelming 78 per cent of voters want cuts to Britain’s wasteful £12.4 billion annual aid budget, and the money diverted to the Health Service instead. 
If a tenth of the aid budget was diverted to the NHS, the £1.24 billion would pay for around three million stays in a hospital bed.

attributes.action: Bring England in line with the rest of the UK and stop NHS prescription charges.
attributes.background: It is fundamentally unfair that citizens in England have to pay NHS prescription charges (currently £8.40) whilst in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland they are free. These charges raise less than 0.5% of the NHS budget so are negligible, we in England should receive parity with the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Legalise the pharmaceutical production of THC for medicinal purposes.
attributes.background: Across the world THC has been proven to benefit a massive range of medical issues, from Anxiety disorders to Parkinson's disease. It is a neuropathic relaxant and can give those in need more control therefore enhancing their wellbeing, independence and reduces the use of other treatments.
attributes.additional_details:
The argument against this is the fear of drug abuse - which is already unregulated and rife. Unlike alcohol and tobacco; there is no evidence of overdose, violence or suicide under the influence of THC. It's neuropathic relaxants enhance endorphins.
In legalising the pharmaceutical production, companies can create a medicated and prescribable form of THC which can be monitored and managed by clinicians.
Presently, there are no controls and those in medical need suffer in desperation.

attributes.action: Stop the College of Policing requiring Police to have a degree before joining.
attributes.background: The College of policing are requiring new officers to have a degree or a 3 year apprenticeship before joining. Currently there are around 38% of officers who have a degree. As a current special constable alot of the officers I serve with haven't got a degree and their policing skills are fantastic!

attributes.action: Evacuate Aleppo with joint UN task force, giving refuge in Britain to citizens.
attributes.background: The city of Aleppo has been conquered by the dictator Assad. His forces are massacring its people - men, women and children. It is preventable. Ask the government to petition a UN/EU task force to immediately go into the city as peacekeepers, not to directly fight Assad, but to evacuate citizens.
attributes.additional_details: All over twitter, Aleppo refugees are posting how the government is murdering them en masse. Innocent men, women and children. The UN must condemn the massacre as against international law, and the UN, failing them the EU, failing that Britain alone, mut notify Assad of its intent, and send a task force to the city. Not to fight Assad's forces directly, but to advise his troops to not engage, & to protect any citizen fleeing the city against his troops, withdrawing when the people are removed.

attributes.action: Reword Rule 59 of the Highway code from 'should' to 'must'
attributes.background: The current wording of Rule 59 allows cyclists to ignore the suggestions. The rule should be revised so that cyclists MUST wear a safety helmet and at least one article of fluorescent or reflective clothing and/or accessory (visible from front and rear) at all times when cycling on the highway.
attributes.additional_details:
Car drivers and passengers MUST wear a safety belt, therefore it stands to reason that cyclists MUST wear a cycling helmet and a fluorescent/reflective item when cycling. This would help to reduce the number of incidents which occur on the roads.
There were 21,287 reported cycling casualties in 2014. Source: http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/pedal-cyclists/facts-figures/
Many of these could have been avoided if cyclists were easier to see.

attributes.action: Begin phasing out the sale of new fossil-fuel powered cars by 2018
attributes.background: Although by no means the only cause of air pollution, there is an opportunity to make inroads into NOx emissions by the gradual phasing-out of fossil-fuel powered cars, commencing with banning company car fleets from purchasing anything other than fully electric vehicles by 2018.
attributes.additional_details: Then, sales of private non-electric-powered cars must be prohibited by 2025.  Obviously, this must be supported by additional scrappage schemes to help those who must buy cars to meet the additional costs of electric vehicles AND (more importantly), massively increased investment in public transport but by starting with fleets, this will mean the first phase of eliminating fossil fuel powered cars will by carried out by those best placed to absorb the costs - i.e. large businesses
